src:
Bocah yang Hanyut di Kali Cipinang Ditemukan Tewas di KBT Duren Sawit
07 Nov 2019, 09:32 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - Pencarian bocah 10 tahun yang hanyut di Kali Cipinang, Jakarta Timur, selesai. Korban ditemukan dalam kondisi tak bernyawa di Kanal Banjir Timur (KBT) Duren Sawit.
"Korban ditemukan di bawah jembatan KBT Duren Sawit pukul 07.46 WIB," kata Kasi Ops Sudin Penanggulangan Kebakaran dan Penyelamatan (PKP) Jaktim, Gatot Sulaiman, dalam keterangannya, Kamis (7/11/2019).
Dari video yang diterima detikcom, setelah ditemukan jasad korban bernama Ahdan Chaerul Azam (10) itu langsung dievakuasi petugas. Petugas Sudin PKP Jaktim tampak dibantu petugas UPK Badan Air untuk mengangkat jasad korban ke daratan.
"Korban dibawa ke rumah duka untuk diserahkan kepada pihak keluarga," ujar Gatot.
Kegiatan hari ini merupakan pencarian hari kedua. Korban diketahui tercebur di Kali Cipinang pada Selasa (5/11) sekitar pukul 18.45 WIB. Saat itu korban berjalan bersama tiga temannya.
"Informasinya, dia bertiga, mau ke musala itu jalan sudah tergenang air. Waktu itu hujan masih deras di situ paritnya kan lebarnya 2-3 meter. Kata temannya, dia lompat ke air. Temannya sempat pengen bantu pakai kayu cuma karena arusnya deras, dia hanyut," ucap Gatot, Rabu (6/11).
"Tapi kalau kata orang tuanya, korban ini terpeleset waktu jalan karena kan hujannya deras," sambung Gatot.

(jbr/aan)
text:
The Boy Drifting in Cipinang River Found Dead in KBT Duren Sawit
Nov 7 2019, 09:32 by Jabbar Ramdhani
Jakarta - The search for a 10-year-old boy who was washed away in Kali Cipinang, East Jakarta, is complete. The victim was found dead in the East Flood Canal (KBT) Duren Sawit.
"The victim was found under the KBT Duren Sawit bridge at 07.46 West Indonesian Time," said Kasi Ops Sub-dept. Of Fire and Rescue (PKP) East Jakarta, Gatot Sulaiman, in his statement on Thursday (11/07/2019).
From the video received by AFP, after it was found the body of the victim named Ahdan Chaerul Azam (10) was immediately evacuated by officers. The East Jakarta PKP Sub-dept. Of Field Service officers was assisted by UPK Water Agency officers to lift the bodies of victims to the mainland.
"The victim was taken to a funeral home to be handed over to the family," said Gatot.
Today's activity is the second day's search. The victim was found splashed in Cipinang River on Tuesday (11/5) around 18:45 WIB. At that time the victim walked with three friends.
"The information, he said, the three of them, going to the musala the road was flooded. At that time the rain was still heavy there, the trench was 2-3 meters wide. Said his friend, he jumped into the water. washed away, "said Gatot, Wednesday (6/11).
"But if his parents say, the victim slipped while walking because it was raining heavily," continued Gatot.

(jbr / aan)
